about.title: Welcome to The White Horse
about.tagline: A Waterbeach village hub reborn with Himalayan hospitality
description: Opposite Waterbeach village green, The White Horse is a relaxed, contemporary pub and restaurant saved from redevelopment and relaunched February 6, 2025 by Lapen Inns.

We blend the charm of a traditional British pub with an extensive menu of authentic Nepalese cuisine: Bhutuwa chicken, Pokhareli fish curry, and Rara king prawns sit happily beside Sunday roasts, well-kept cask ales, and live sports.
Families, locals, and visitors gather here for quality food, live sport, and a genuine welcome that extends to your four-legged friends in our large rear garden.
features: Authentic Nepalese cuisine prepared with traditional recipes by Ravi Acharya and Purna Man Bajrachaya
Traditional British pub with cask ales: Greene King IPA and Timothy Taylor Landlord
Live sports on Sky Sports and TNT Sports with large garden and outdoor seating
Dog-friendly bar with water bowls and treats on hand

image.alt: Thatched exterior of The White Horse Waterbeach facing the village green

signatureDishes.title: Signature Nepalese Dishes
signatureDishes.subtitle: Press-lauded favourites from our authentic Himalayan kitchen

items.name: Lasun Kukhura Khursani (LKK) Chicken
items.description: Garlicky chilli wok-fried chicken finished with toasted cumin and coriander, a fiery LKK favourite for spice lovers.

items.name: Himali Lamb
items.description: Himalayan green curry of slow-braised lamb enriched with mint-yoghurt and fenugreek for a fragrant, velvety sauce.

items.name: Khasi Ko Masu (Goat Curry)
items.description: Traditional goat curry simmered low-and-slow with roasted spices and tomato, delivering deep warmth without overwhelming heat.

items.name: House Mixed Grill
items.description: Sizzling platter stacked with wings, tikka, seekh kebab and lemon-splashed king prawn‚Äîideal for sharing from the tandoor.

items.quote: Tasty Nepalese food with quick service; staff were polite, friendly and informative.
A local gem with amazing food and a warm welcome.
Team helped tailor spice levels; large group visit was a hit.
Welcoming pub; the Rum Rum Chicken stood out and service was friendly.
Excellent pub, very reasonable pricing‚Ä¶ very attentive staff‚Ä¶ food is absolutely amazing.
Yummy food, friendly staff, no long wait. Dog-friendly. Lovely way to spend Mother's Day!
Excellent service and food was amazing!

pressFeature.title: Village pub saved from redevelopment as Nepalese restaurant
pressFeature.summary: Local media celebrates how Lapen Inns rescued The White Horse, bringing authentic Himalayan cuisine to Waterbeach while preserving the community pub.
pressFeature.quote: "The locals were more excited than I am - they thought it would be turned into flats. The regulars turned up and they were all very welcoming."

openGraph.title: About The White Horse ‚Äì Our Story

hero.title: About The White Horse
hero.subtitle: A friendly village pub opposite Waterbeach green - saved, revitalized, and serving authentic Nepalese cuisine alongside British pub classics.

story.title: Our Story
story.introduction: Opposite the Waterbeach village green, The White Horse was saved from potential redevelopment and relaunched on February 6, 2025 by Lapen Inns. Today we blend a traditional British pub atmosphere with an extensive menu of authentic Nepalese cuisine - Bhutuwa chicken, Pokhareli fish curry, and momo alongside cask ales, live sports, and Sunday roasts in our relaxed, contemporary setting.

timeline.title: Historic Village Pub
timeline.description: The White Horse has been at the heart of Waterbeach village life for over a century, serving as a beloved community gathering place opposite the village green.

timeline.title: Evolution & Adaptation
timeline.description: Through the years, the pub evolved - from classic pub fare to Thai food in 2009, then British/Italian gastropub offerings. This history of culinary reinvention demonstrates our commitment to serving the community with exciting, quality food.

timeline.title: A New Chapter: The Lapen Inns Revival
timeline.description: Acquired by Lapen Inns (led by Subodh Gautam, Diwakar Subedi, Ravi Acharya, and Purna Man Bajrachaya), The White Horse was rescued from closure. Officially reopened January 31, 2025, with our Nepalese menu launching February 6. We preserve the core essence of a community pub while introducing authentic Himalayan cuisine - creating two robust revenue streams and a unique dining destination.

items.name: Sarah Johnson
items.text: Absolutely wonderful! The Nepalese dishes are authentic and delicious, and the traditional pub atmosphere is so welcoming. Perfect for families.

items.name: Mike Thompson
items.text: Great food and fantastic service. The best of both worlds - proper pub classics and amazing curry. Highly recommended!

items.question: Do you accept bookings?
items.answer: Yes, we accept bookings by phone. Call us on +44 1223 375578 to reserve your table. We recommend booking in advance, especially for weekends.

items.question: Are you family-friendly?
items.answer: Absolutely! We welcome families with children until 9pm. We have a children's menu and high chairs available.

items.question: Do you offer takeaway?
items.answer: Yes! Order online for quick pickup ü•° or call if you prefer.

items.question: Is parking available?
items.answer: Yes, we have free parking available for our customers.

slides.alt: Exterior of The White Horse country pub on a sunny day with chalkboards by the door and a wide forecourt.
slides.eyebrow: Your village pub for cosy pints, fresh plates & big-sky evenings.
slides.headline: Welcome to The White Horse
slides.copy: A friendly, independent local where characterful interiors meet a spacious garden, and the menu ranges from comforting classics to bright, modern bites.

slides.alt: Long rustic table layered with Nepalese sharing plates, salads, pickles, and drinks ready for a crowd inside the pub.
slides.eyebrow: Gather the crew around a table full of colour.
slides.headline: Feasts Made for Sharing
slides.copy: Mix momo, samosa, onion bhaji, crispy squid, and crunchy salads for the ultimate White Horse feast ‚Äî ideal for family-style dining or laid-back celebrations.

slides.alt: Warm wood bar with glass racks and a row of beer taps in a cosy pub interior.
slides.eyebrow: Cask ales, craft lagers & small-batch spirits.
slides.headline: Pouring Character
slides.copy: From perfectly kept pints to classic cocktails, our bar team knows their way around a pour. Pull up a stool and settle in.

slides.alt: Large pub garden at dusk with string lights and wooden picnic tables.
slides.eyebrow: Big garden energy ‚Äì gather, relax, and watch the sky turn indigo.
slides.headline: Evenings Under the Lights
slides.copy: From golden hour to starlight, our garden is your go-to for after-work drinks, weekend catch-ups, and easy outdoor dining.

slides.alt: Bowl of mixed green salad with cherry tomatoes and cucumber on a white plate.
slides.eyebrow: Crunchy greens, bright flavours, made to order.
slides.headline: Fresh Starts
slides.copy: A simple, satisfying bowl‚Äîcrisp leaves, juicy tomatoes, cool cucumber and a zesty house dressing. Perfect on its own or alongside a pint.

slides.alt: Row of steamed dumplings with bright orange dipping sauce on a rectangular plate.
slides.eyebrow: Steamed, delicate, and dunked in our bold chilli sauce.
slides.headline: Hand-Pleated momo
slides.copy: Comfort in one bite - soft wrappers, savoury filling, and a creamy kick on the side. A favourite for sharing or not.

slides.alt: Mixed green salad topped with warm seared chicken pieces and cherry tomatoes.
slides.eyebrow: Warm chicken salad with crunch and zing.
slides.headline: Hearty & Healthy
slides.copy: Tender seared chicken tossed through fresh greens and a lively dressing - big on flavour, light on fuss.
